job_title: Intern ‚Äì Geology Greenfields Exploration - North America
job_description: Website: www.anglogoldashanti.com SUMMARY / OBJECTIVE OF ROLE The US Greenfields Exploration (GFX) intern will be responsible for supporting the Greenfields Exploration team on projects that may include developing early-stage exploration projects though geologic investigation, leveraging GIS and 3-D modeling software, assisting drill program operations, and writing procedures and guidelines. Role Accountabilities: Aid the geology team in the execution of exploration activities including assisting with geologic mapping, surface sampling, drill program management, soil sampling, document management, and digital workspace organization. Use ArcGIS and LeapFrog Geo software to create, manipulate, and validate 2D and 3D data in support of GIS, and other spatial data projects for our US Exploration operations. Example data types include geologic mapping, satellite imagery, drilling, geochemical samples, land boundaries, etc. Assist with data management, digitization, and organization. Assist the Senior Geologist in side projects supporting the overall exploration workflow. Technical Competencies: Basic understanding of exploration techniques, including mapping and sampling. Experience in GIS and modeling software platforms (ESRI ArcGIS and Leapfrog Geo). Must be able to: crawl, crouch, kneel, sit, climb, walk, stoop, and stand frequently. work outside for extended periods in extreme temperatures. walk on uneven terrain and slopes for an extended period. lift to 50 pounds at times. Near vision must be sufficient to read, without strain, printed material the size of typewritten character. Normal depth perception and field of vision are required, as is the ability to distinguish basic colors. Must be able to legally drive company vehicles if assigned. Will be required to wear Personal Protective Equipment, including steel toed boots, high-visibility clothing, protective eyewear, and hearing protection. Leadership & Management Competencies: Preforms activities with limited supervision while remaining within agreed boundaries of activities, methodologies, and company policies & procedures. Fosters a positive team environment and able to collaborate well with others. Detailed organizational, planning, and analytical skills. EDUCATION & QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate or graduate degree in Geology. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE: Strong awareness and commitment to safety in the workplace and at the project site. In the process of completing a degree in Geology. Problem-solving skills Be self-motivated; have an ‚Äúinvestigative / curious‚Äù nature; and be driven to help the entire organization successfully achieve its goals Excellent verbal and written communication skills- listening, reasoning, speaking, and presenting COMPENSATION: Undergraduate: $27/hour Graduate: $35/hour AngloGold Ashanti Limited Reg No: 1944/017354/06 EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT AngloGold Ashanti North America Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type with regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Why Join our Tax Technology Team as an Intern? At Grant Thornton, our Tax Technology team works with large, complex organizations to improve how tax departments operate by implementing scalable technology solutions and driving meaningful process improvements. Our work spans a range of areas, including the design, configuration, and integration of tax engines for both direct and indirect taxes. We help clients automate and streamline calculation, compliance, and reporting activities, building long-term efficiency and accuracy into their operations. Beyond tax engines, we work with a variety of modern platforms outside of traditional tax software. This includes enterprise systems, data automation tools, workflow tracking solutions, and visualization platforms. We support clients in streamlining data collection, implementing workflow automation, enhancing tax data management, and integrating emerging technologies like AI to solve complex tax challenges. job_title: Intern ‚Äì AI/HPC System with Advanced Memory System Research
job_description: Job Title: Intern - AI/HPC System with Advanced Memory System Research (Summer 2026) Office Location: San Jose, CAWork Model: OnsiteDuration: June 2026 - August 2026 At SK hynix America, we're at the forefront of semiconductor innovation, developing advanced memory solutions that power everything from smartphones to data centers. As a global leader in DRAM and NAND flash technologies, we drive the evolution of advancing mobile technology, empowering cloud computing, and pioneering future technologies. Our cutting-edge memory technologies are essential in today's most advanced electronic devices and IT infrastructure, enabling enhanced performance and user experiences across the digital landscape. We're looking for innovative minds to join our mission of shaping the future of technology. At SK hynix America, you'll be part of a team that's pioneering breakthrough memory solutions while maintaining a strong commitment to sustainability. We're not just adapting to technological change ‚Äì we're driving it, with significant investments in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and eco-friendly solutions and operational practices. As we continue to expand our market presence and push the boundaries of what's possible in semiconductor technology, we invite you to be part of our journey to creating the next generation of memory solutions that will define the future of computing. Responsibilities: Demonstrate feasibility of AI system with advanced memory solutions (HBM, CXL memory) Excellent in reading research papers and implementing them to code Build and evaluate the advanced memory system for an LLM training/inferencing Qualifications: Accepted or currently enrolled in a PhD/MS program in Computer Science or a related STEM field Expected to complete degree by July 2027 or earlier for PhD‚Äôs and 2026 for MS candidates Hands on experience with ML/DL frameworks like TensorFlow/Keras or PyTorch Excellent programming skills in Python, CUDA, and C Housing Allowance: Eligible interns will receive a housing allowance during their internship. Equal Employment Opportunity:SKHYA is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, religion, age, gender identity, national origin, color, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. Compensation:Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. Pay within the provided range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related skills and experience. Your Recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.Pay Range$26 - $50 USD

At Dow, we believe in putting people first and we‚Äôre passionate about delivering integrity, respect and safety to our customers, our employees and the planet.¬†¬†¬†Our people are at the heart of our solutions. They reflect the communities we live in and the world where we do business. Their diversity is our strength. We‚Äôre a community of relentless problem solvers that offers the daily opportunity to contribute with your perspective, transform industries and shape the future. Our purpose is simple - to deliver a sustainable future for the world through science and collaboration.¬†If you‚Äôre looking for a challenge and meaningful role, you‚Äôre in the right place.¬†Dow has a Data Engineering Internship opportunity within Dow's Enterprise Data & Analytics organization.This position is an in-person, full-time internship role based out of Champaign, IL at the Dow Delivery Center at UIUC (University of Illinois Urbana Champaign). Individuals who are within one to three years of graduation and are currently enrolled at the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign working towards a Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in a related technical field are encouraged to apply.¬†The duration of the internship is typically 11-12 weeks during the Summer 2026.As a Data Engineer Intern, you will work with a cross-functional team whose objective is to deliver solutions that drive business value for Dow. Recent solutions include carbon visibility, plastics circularity, and sales opportunities utilizing our enterprise data ecosystem. The Data Engineer Intern will focus on the ingestion, persistence and curation of data as defined by specific projects. The on-site Dow Delivery Center at UIUC people manager and technical manager will provide in-person mentorship across your day-to-day activities.The Data Engineer Intern will work closely with a multi-disciplinary team to:¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Create data pipelines for projects in the Azure environment.Design, develop, test, and implement analytics. This includes the curation and ingestion of data from different source systems, driving end-to-end data flow for multiple solutions.Identify opportunities for innovating with digital capabilities aiming to accelerate Dow‚Äôs digital transformation.QualificationsRequired:Must be currently enrolled at the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign.Must be working towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related technical field.Must be¬†within one to three years of graduation.A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.¬† No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.Preferred:A GPA of¬†3.0¬†or higher.A degree discipline in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or other Engineering DisciplinesExperience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP or Azure.Familiarity with Python, Scala, and SQL programming languages.Familiarity with data warehouse/lakehouse platforms such as Snowflake or DatabricksExperience with structured/semi-/non-structured databases, data ingestion, and data modeling.Multi-application and cross-platform design experience.Proficiency in data visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI.Knowledge of Agile Methodology, Scrum, or Kanban methodologies.Knowledge of version control systems and code review practices.SkillsTechnical Proficiency: Background in computer science, computer information systems or other engineering disciplines. Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or Azure. Familiarity with Python, Scala, and SQL programming languages.Problem-Solving Skills: Effectively troubleshoots and resolves issues.Collaboration and Communication: Works well with cross-functional teams and communicates effectively (spoken and written).Security and Compliance: Familiarity with security and compliance best practices and standards.Innovation and Improvement: Continuously seeks opportunities to improve existing processes and implement new technologies.¬†Documentation and Reporting: Maintains thorough documentation of processes, solutions, and best practices.Time Management & Organizational Skills: Ability to manage your own work effort with little supervision.Additional notesThis position does not offer relocation or housing assistance.Must have access to public transportation or have personal/reliable transportation during the work term to complete internship shifts in-person at the Dow Delivery Center at UIUC.For positions based in Illinois, Dow is required by law to include the pay scale that is reasonably expected to represent the pay range for the position.¬†This pay range is specific to the State of Illinois and accounts for both new and experienced employees with consideration to factors including but not limited to skillset, experience, and sustained job performance (or similar jobs). A reasonable pay range for this position is:¬† Bachelors: ¬†$25.72-$34.28 per hour; Masters: $36.35-$38.41 per hour¬†About DowDow (NYSE: DOW) is one of the world‚Äôs leading materials science companies, serving customers in high-growth markets such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer applications.¬†Our global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation, leading business positions and commitment to sustainability enable us to achieve profitable growth and help deliver a sustainable future. We operate manufacturing sites in 30¬†countries and employ approximately¬†36,000 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately¬†$43 billion¬†in 2024. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãLearn more about us and our ambition to be the most innovative, customer-centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company in the world by visiting www.dow.com.As part of our dedication to inclusion, Dow is committed to equal opportunities in employment. We encourage every employee to bring their whole self to work each day to not only deliver more value, but also have a more fulfilling career. Further information regarding Dow's equal opportunities is available on www.dow.com.Dow is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and is committed to providing opportunities without regard for race, color, religion, sex, including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity, national origin, age, disability and genetic information, including family medical history. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may call us at 1-833-My Dow HR (833-693-6947) and select option 8.

Please Note: This is a Utah-based hybrid position which will require some regular in-office days each week. Additionally, employment with BambooHR is contingent on passing both a background and credit check. Essential Job Duties As a Software Developer Intern (undergraduate), you will contribute to the current and next generation of our award-winning app on either our Backend or Frontend teams! You‚Äôll be working alongside our incredible engineers, making changes to our live site within a few weeks of your internship (that's right, we release wicked fast!). You‚Äôll be paired with a skilled mentor who will help you develop your skills and make the most of your internship experience. If you get a kick out of solving problems and building beautiful, world-class software, then you will love BambooHR. On the Backend, we design database schemas, create API endpoints, integrate with multiple systems, tame business logic, and product designs into an orderly collection of classes, build tools that help customers, systems administrators, and other engineers. We use PHP, MySQL, C#, SqlServer, and many other technologies in our stack. On the Frontend, we work closely with UX designers, product managers, and our backend software engineers to create a highly polished and interactive frontend in React for our enterprise-level web application. Our stack consists of Webpack, Babel, React, and an abstraction of Material UI within our design system. You will: Practice a scrum-like agile development process using CI/CD systems. Work with a world-class product development team to integrate your projects into the application. Contribute to the ongoing improvement of our systems and processes. Come to work, do great things, then go home! Integrate AI into your daily tasks using IDEs (or plugins) such as Github Copilot and Windsurf. Leverage ChatGPT to streamline your workload by brainstorming and refining ideas, and planning projects. Join our fast-paced team as we innovate at the speed of AI. AI is integrated into our products, development processes, and IDEs. We utilize AI tools like Windsurf, ChatGPT, Claude, Sonnet, Grok, and Gemini in our daily work. This will be a paid, full-time internship (M-F, 8-5), running from May 2026 to August 2026. What You Need to Get the Job Done Experience in an object-oriented programming language (backend) Basic education with web development (frontend) Familiarity with relational databases (backend) Familiarity with version control software, preferably Git You live within commuting distance of our Draper, UT office Excited to integrate AI-powered features into front-end workflows, such as real-time personalized UI elements, dynamic content rendering, or customized chatbot interactions using prompt engineering. What Will Make Us REALLY Love You You can show that you're an excellent communicator We can see that you have a service-minded attitude Experience with multiple programming languages You can show us an awesome capstone project What You'll Love About Us A Great Company Culture that has been recognized by multiple organizations like Inc, and Salt Lake Tribune Paid time off for summer holidays and birthdays 401k plans with up to 6% company match Join us for company events during the summer We pay for a one year subscription to Financial Peace University and you walk away with financial savvy and a bonus About Us At BambooHR, we're building something different: we're building a people intelligence platform that transforms HR and sets people free to do great work! We're a proven market leader driving innovation while building lasting success through thoughtful, sustainable growth. Here, you'll find a place that champions growth: both professional and personal, both individual and collective. We invest in potential, giving you the space to stretch your capabilities and turn good ideas into reality while providing the safety net of a supportive, values-driven culture. Our approach combines meaningful work with meaningful lives, offering competitive benefits, professional development, and the flexibility to thrive both in and outside the office. What sets us apart isn't just what we do, but how we do it: with openness, integrity, and a shared commitment to doing the right thing. Join us in creating HR software that makes work better for everyone, while we make work better for you. BambooHR is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals and will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations throughout the hiring process. If you would like to request accommodations, please let your recruiter know. BambooHR is An Equal Opportunity Employer--M/F/D/VBecause our team members are trusted to handle sensitive information, we require all candidates that receive and accept employment offers to complete a background check before being hired. For information on California Privacy Policy, click here. Our process utilizes AI as an assistant to efficiently process and analyze candidate data. Recruiters and hiring managers maintain full oversight and accountability, ensuring that all final selection and rejection decisions are human-made and based solely on objective job qualifications. Please see our General Privacy Notice and California Privacy Notice for more details. See our AI Guidelines for Candidates for details on how BambooHR uses AI in recruiting, how we expect candidates to use AI, and what is not allowed.

Tecovas was founded with the simple goal of making the world's best western boots, apparel, and leather goods, and selling them at a fair price. We are a brand reimagining a category and welcoming both first-time boot buyers and seasoned western enthusiasts alike. The Internship Program at Tecovas is an opportunity for undergraduate and graduate students to expand their skill set and put action to key learnings. As a key part of our mission of growth and development here at Tecovas, we want to showcase how we strive to make our employee and customer experience better than anywhere else. This is a meaningful opportunity to learn about the inner workings of a quickly growing and highly collaborative company. Tecovas is looking for a Data & Analytics Intern to embark on a data-driven journey to understand customer lifetime value. Reporting directly to the Data Analyst, you will take on a clearly phased project, starting with foundational KPI reporting and progressing to more advanced Predictive Lifetime Value (PLTV) analysis. Additionally, you will collaborate with business users, build key reports, and develop a predictive model, culminating in a final presentation of your analysis and findings. This position is based out of Austin, TX with regular in office attendance expected. Must be available for the full duration of the internship (12 weeks). Please note that this internship opportunity is available only to current and active Tecovas employees. If you are not a Tecovas employee, you will not be considered for this position. What you‚Äôll do: Meet with business stakeholders to gather, clarify, and document requirements for KPI reports. Write and execute advanced SQL queries to extract and transform customer and sales data. Develop and validate the logic for calculating key metrics such as Active Customers, Cross-Category purchasing, and PLTV. Build and update data visualizations and dashboards in a BI tool to make reports accessible and understandable. Analyze and interpret data trends to provide insights and identify anomalies. Collaborate with a mentor on data modeling techniques for the Predictive Lifetime Value (PLTV) project. Document data sources, definitions, and query logic to ensure your work is repeatable and understandable Experience we‚Äôre looking for: Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced SQL and data manipulation skills. Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and predictive analytics fundamentals. Experience with stakeholder management, requirements gathering, and data storytelling What you bring to the table: Analytical Curiosity: A natural desire to dig into data, ask questions, and understand the "why" behind the numbers. Proactive Communicator: The confidence to engage with business users, ask clarifying questions, and clearly present your findings. Problem-Solving Drive: The ability to independently troubleshoot issues, whether in a SQL query or a data model. Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to your work, ensuring that data is accurate and reports are precise. Eagerness to Learn and Adapt: A strong desire to absorb new technical skills and business concepts as the project evolves. Requirements Must be located in the Austin, TX area Must be available to work up to 32 hours per week, Monday - Friday (between the hours of 8AM-5PM CST) Must be at least 18 years of age or older Must have reliable transportation Able to lift up to 30 pounds regularly Internship program culminates with a presentation to our leadership team summarizing your experience at Tecovas with key takeaways and feedback regarding the program. Internship Perks: Competitive hourly rate - starting at $18/hour; The actual compensation will be based on factors such as the candidate‚Äôs skills, qualifications, and experience. Daily lunch stipend Gain more insight and professional experience into the departments that help a direct-to-consumer retail organization succeed About Us: Based in Austin, TX, Tecovas brings the spirit of the West to the modern consumer. Handcrafting the best Western footwear, workwear, apparel, and accessories, Tecovas has grown rapidly since its founding as the first digitally native Western brand in 2015, serving customers through www.Tecovas.com, Tecovas Stores from coast to coast, and select wholesale partners. We‚Äôre certainly growing- and hiring passionate, humble, positive, and talented people determined to help us continue to grow! Important note: We strive to hire values-aligned people because we believe it takes each and all of us to be successful, and lead with grit, speed and a clear vision of where we‚Äôre headed. In a remote setting, interviewing at Tecovas may include phone interviews, virtual ‚Äúon-site‚Äù interviews, and on-the-job mock cases. We are committed to run a thorough process for candidates with whom we identify a potential match, and we will do our best to follow-up with each and every applicant! If you‚Äôre on the fence, just give it a try! We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all qualified individuals to apply! Information collected during the application process is subject to our privacy policy. Please note: Offers of employment may be conditional pending the completion of standard onboarding procedures.

Intern (Developer) - Master Data Management, GT Operational ExperienceInternCompany Description‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not in the shipping business; we‚Äôre in the information business‚Äù -Peter Rose, Expeditors FounderGlobal supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.18,000 trained professionals350+ locations worldwide across 60+ countriesFortune 500Globally unified systemsJob Description‚ÄãAs an intern, you will be fully integrated into one of our agile teams within the Master Data Management group and learn what it is like to work as a developer at Expeditors. You will be given a unique intern project to create business and technical functionality that spans the entire software development lifecycle. This opportunity will allow you to learn about Expeditors as a world class global logistics company while growing your technical, communication, and collaboration skills in our Global Technology department.This position is on-site. Candidates must be local or willing to relocate. Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.QualificationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSComputer Science MajorTeam-orientedPositive attitudeCustomer service mindsetExcellent communication skills Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not transfer or sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (such as an H-1B visa) for this opportunity.Additional InformationExpected base salary: $22.30/hour to $32.30/hourExpeditors offers excellent benefits:Paid Sick Time (accrual rate of 1 hour of sick time per 30 hours paid)Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DC FSA)Commuter BenefitEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Company OverviewKLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world‚Äôs leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow‚Äôs electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.Job Description/Preferred QualificationsCalling all builders, tinkerers and AI enthusiasts! üì¢ The ESG team is growing, and we‚Äôre looking for an intern to help design and build a multi‚Äëagent ecosystem that powers our ESG reporting ‚Äî using Copilot Studio topics and plugins, integrated data sources, and end‚Äëto‚Äëend automated workflows and testing.¬†If you love turning complex reporting needs into smart automations, experimenting with agentic ecosystems, and shaping data‚Äëdriven sustainability solutions, this is a chance to make a real impact.Technical Skills:Hands-on experience with Copilot Studio Builder and Power Automate (or similar).Ability to turn reporting needs into clear automations and measurable outcomes.Strong communicator comfortable with cross-functional collaboration.Curiosity about multi-agent orchestration and M365 integrations.Bonus (not required): familiarity with Power Apps/Power BI, GitHub, Azure, Open AI, Python or prompt/LLM evaluation.Mindset:Builder and systems thinker, eager to experiment, learn and refine processes that scale.User-focused collaborator, ensuring workflows are maintainable and aligned multi-functionally.Ownership-driven and adaptable, taking initiative and thriving in a fast-paced innovation-friendly environment.Minimum QualificationsPrior internship, project or lab experience building automations or agentic workflows.Upper-level undergraduate or graduate student in a technical discipline (or equivalent experience).Interest in sustainability/ESG and data-driven reporting.Practical exposure to Copilot Studio and Power Automate (or similar).Base Pay Range: $21.00 - $30.00 per hour based on pursuit of a Bachelors and MastersPrimary Location: USA-MI-Ann Arbor-KLAKLA‚Äôs total rewards package for employees may also include participation in performance incentive programs and eligibility for additional benefits including but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, life, and other voluntary benefits, 401(K) including company matching, employee stock purchase program (ESPP), student debt assistance, tuition reimbursement program, development and career growth opportunities and programs, financial planning benefits, wellness benefits including an employee assistance program (EAP), paid time off and paid company holidays, and family care and bonding leave.Interns are eligible for some of the benefits listed. Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed reflects the pay for this position in the primary location identified in this posting. Actual pay depends on several factors, including state minimum pay wage rates, location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education level or training. We are committed to complying with all applicable federal and state minimum wage requirements where applicable. If applicable, your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process.KLA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We will ensure that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at talent.acquisition@kla.com or at +1-408-352-2808 to request accommodation.Be aware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiting activity by persons that are currently posing as KLA employees.¬† KLA never asks for any financial compensation to be considered for an interview, to become an employee, or for equipment. Further, KLA does not work with any recruiters or third parties who charge such fees either directly or on behalf of KLA. Please ensure that you have searched KLA‚Äôs Careers website for legitimate job postings.¬† KLA follows a recruiting process that involves multiple interviews in person or on video conferencing with our hiring managers. ¬†If you are concerned that a communication, an interview, an offer of employment, or that an employee is not legitimate, please send an email to talent.acquisition@kla.com to confirm the person you are communicating with is an employee. We take your privacy very seriously and confidentially handle your information.
